greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of connected components remaining when decimal expansion of the number n is cut from a piece of paper.
example: We assume 1,2,3,5 have no hole; 0,4,6,9 have 1 hole; 8 has two holes. So cutting 8 from a piece of paper creates three connected components: one for each hole and one for the remainder of the paper. Hence a(8)=3.
results.author: _Matthew Conroy_, Oct 11 2001
